title: Hydropower generation to reach 20800 mw after completion of 10 under construction dams: Farrukh
content:
ISLAMABAD, Feb 13 (APP): Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting Farrukh Habib said on Sunday that after the construction of 1967 Tarbela Dam, now Prime Minister Imran Khan was constructing ten big dams in Pakistan which would enable the country to generate cheap power.
In his tweet, the Minister of State said that these projects would increase the production of hydropower from 9500 mw to 20800 mw.
1967 تربیلا ڈیم کے بعد وزیراعظم عمران خان پاکستان میں 10 بڑے ڈیمز   بنارہے ہیں۔پن بجلی کی پیداوار 9500 MW سے 20800 MWہوجائے گی سستی بجلی کی پیداوار ممکن ہوگی۔کل انشاللہ واپڈا کے زیر اہتمام آسٹریلیا، سوزرلینڈ، امریکہ، ترکی،  چائنہ سمیت ڈیمز کےماہرین کی عالمی کانفرنس ہوگی۔ pic.twitter.com/tFf296gVME
— Farrukh Habib (@FarrukhHabibISF) February 13, 2022
He said that an international conference under the aegis of Water and Power Development Authority would be held tomorrow which would be attended by dams experts from many countries including Australia, Switzerland, United States, China and Turkey.
